en: Surely there is a mine for silver, And a place for gold which they refine.
hmr: “Tangkaruo ta ding chun cho- suokna hmun chu a um ngei a nih, Rângkachak ta dinga sukthiengna hmun leh.

en: Iron is taken out of the earth, And copper is molten out of the stone.
hmr: Thîr chu leihnuoia inthawka lâk suok a na, Dârsen ruok chu lunga inthawka emtuia lâk suok a nih.

en: Man setteth an end to darkness, And searcheth out, to the furthest bound, The stones of obscurity and of thick darkness.
hmr: Mihriemin inthimna a suktâwp a, Thina hlim le inthimna lung sâmuphai chu, A hmun hlatakahai chun a zawng suok hlak.

en: He breaketh open a shaft away from where men sojourn; They are forgotten of the foot; They hang afar from men, they swing to and fro.
hmr: A ram hluotuhai um nawnaa chun khur an cho a, A chunga fehai chun an theinghil a; Mi hlatnaah an inkhai a, an inthên an inthên a.

en: As for the earth, out of it cometh bread; And underneath it is turned up as it were by fire.
hmr: Hnuoi ruok chu amaa inthawk chun bei a hung suok a, A hnuoitieng chu, inlet chun chu mei ang el a nih.

en: The stones thereof are the place of sapphires, And it hath dust of gold.
hmr: Chutaka lunghai chu Sapphir lung hmun dâm a na, Rângkachak hlawmhai chu a um a nih.

en: That path no bird of prey knoweth, Neither hath the falcon’s eye seen it:
hmr: Chu lampui chu chunglêng vate sa fami chun a hriet nawh a, Mulukawlhai mit khawm chun a hmu ngai nawh.

en: The proud beasts have not trodden it, Nor hath the fierce lion passed thereby.
hmr: Ramsa chapotakhai khawm chun an sir ngai nawh a, Sakeibaknei ṭiumtak khawm chun a hraw ngai nawh.

en: He putteth forth his hand upon the flinty rock; He overturneth the mountains by the roots.
hmr: “A kut chu lungpui changtak chunga chun a sie suok a, Tlânghai chu a bula inthawkin a kei let a.

en: He cutteth out channels among the rocks; And his eye seeth every precious thing.
hmr: Lungpuihai lai chun tuiluongnahai a cho a, A mithai chun thil hlutak chu a hmuh a.

en: He bindeth the streams that they trickle not; And the thing that is hid bringeth he forth to light.
hmr: An far nawna dingin tuihnârhai chu a ting a, Thil inthupa um chu varah a hung lâk suok tah a.

en: But where shall wisdom be found? And where is the place of understanding?
hmr: Amiruokchu, khâwlai am varna chu hmu nîng a ta? Hrietthiemna hmun khawm chu khâwlai am a na?

en: Man knoweth not the price thereof; Neither is it found in the land of the living.
hmr: Mihriem chun chu man chu an hriet nawh a, Mi hring rama khawm chu chu hmu suok a ni bawk nawh.

en: The deep saith, It is not in me; And the sea saith, It is not with me.
hmr: Khursûng chun, ‘Keimaah a um nawh,’ a ta, Tuisuoriet chun, ‘Keimaah a um nawh,’ a ti bawk a.

en: It cannot be gotten for gold, Neither shall silver be weighed for the price thereof.
hmr: Rângkachaka nei thei a ni nawh a, Chu chu man ding chun tangkaruo khawm bûk thei a ni bawk nawh.

en: It cannot be valued with the gold of Ophir, With the precious onyx, or the sapphire.
hmr: Ophir rângkachak le chun ngaihlut inang thei a ni nawh a, Sapphir amanih, Berul lung hlutak le khawm chun hlut inanga ngai thei a ni nawh.

en: Gold and glass cannot equal it, Neither shall it be exchanged for jewels of fine gold.
hmr: Rângkachak le hlimen chun an tluk thei nawh a, Chu chu thlengpui ding chu rângkachak inthiengtaka thleng thei khawm a ni bawk nawh.

en: No mention shall be made of coral or of crystal: Yea, the price of wisdom is above rubies.
hmr: Tuikeplung amanih, lunghlu khawm chu a hrila hril ding a ni nawh a, Anih, Varna man chu lunghlu chun tluk naw nih a,

en: The topaz of Ethiopia shall not equal it, Neither shall it be valued with pure gold.
hmr: Ethiopia rama Topaz lunghlu chun tluk naw nih a, Rângkachak inthieng le khawm chun a hlut angkhata ngai ding a ni nawh.

en: Whence then cometh wisdom? And where is the place of understanding?
hmr: Anleh, varna chu khâwtaka inthawka hung am a na? Hrietthiemna hmun chu khâwlai am ni tâng a ta?

en: Seeing it is hid from the eyes of all living, And kept close from the birds of the heavens.
hmr: Mi hring po po mithmuhaia inthawka thupa umin, Chunga vatehai kâwla khawm thup a nih.

en: Destruction and Death say, We have heard a rumor thereof with our ears.
hmr: Bohmangna le Thina chun, ‘Chu chu thuthang chu kan nahaiin kan lo hriet a,’ an ta.

en: God understandeth the way thereof, And he knoweth the place thereof.
hmr: “Pathien chun chu lampui chu a hriet a, Chu chu hmun khawm chu a hriet a nih.

en: For he looketh to the ends of the earth, And seeth under the whole heaven;
hmr: Ama chun kâwlkawdawnghai chu a hmuh a, Vân khuphnuoi po po hi a hmu vawng a nih.

en: To make a weight for the wind: Yea, he meteth out the waters by measure.
hmr: Thli hrâtnahai chu a pêk lai khan, Anih, tuihai chu inkhinain ân khi suok a nih.

en: When he made a decree for the rain, And a way for the lightning of the thunder;
hmr: Chu lai chun ruo ta ding chun bi a ruotpêkin, Vâninrûm, kâwlinlep ta ding khawma lampui a siempêk bawk a.

en: Then did he see it, and declare it; He established it, yea, and searched it out.
hmr: Chun, ama chun a hmuh a, a puong tah a, A tungding a, anih, a zawng suok bawk a.

en: And unto man he said, Behold, the fear of the Lord, that is wisdom; And to depart from evil is understanding.
hmr: Chun, mihriem kuoma chun, ‘Ngai ta, Lalpa ṭi chu, varna a nih; Suola inthawka fe hmang chu hrietthiemna a ni bawk a,’ a ta,” tiin
